snippet: Under second-degree murder, the jury must find that a death was caused by a criminal act “demonstrating a depraved mind without regard for human life.”
abstract: Crime of second-degree murder, chosen by special prosecutor Angela B Corey in charging George Zimmerman in the Trayvon Martin case, carries a maximum sentence of life in prison and a minimum sentence of 25 years; it also means that he will not be entitled to be released on bail before his trial.
lead_paragraph: Under second-degree murder, the jury must find that a death was caused by a criminal act “demonstrating a depraved mind without regard for human life.”

headline.seo: Zimmerman Faces Second-Degree Murder Charge in Florida
headline.main: Severe Charge, With a Minimum Term of 25 Years
headline.print_headline: Severe Charge, With a Minimum Term of 25 Years
